# TrumpAccounts.guide

> The #1 plain-English resource for Trump Accounts (IRC Section 530A). Free calculators, IRS Form 4547 walkthrough, and authoritative guides for parents, employers, and tax preparers.

## About

TrumpAccounts.guide translates IRS guidance (Notice 2025-68) into simple language for exhausted parents, employers, and tax preparers. We provide interactive calculators, comparison tools, and authoritative guides about Trump Accounts — the tax-advantaged savings accounts created by the One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), signed July 4, 2025.

This is an independent educational website. We are not affiliated with the IRS, U.S. Treasury, or any government agency. Nothing on this site constitutes tax, financial, or legal advice.

## Core Pages

- [What Are Trump Accounts?](https://trumpaccounts.guide/what-are-trump-accounts): Complete guide to IRC §530A — eligibility, contributions, investments, and what happens at age 18.
- [How to Open a Trump Account](https://trumpaccounts.guide/how-to-open-trump-account): Step-by-step guide to filing IRS Form 4547 with your 2025 tax return.
- [IRS Notice 2025-68 in Plain English](https://trumpaccounts.guide/irs-notice-2025-68): Full IRS guidance translated into simple language.
- [FAQ Hub](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq): 80+ questions answered about eligibility, taxes, investments, and edge cases.
- [Glossary](https://trumpaccounts.guide/glossary): Plain-English definitions for every Trump Account term.

## Calculators

- [Growth Calculator](https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/growth-calculator): Project how much a Trump Account could be worth at age 18.
- [Eligibility Checker](https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/eligibility-checker): Check if your child qualifies for a Trump Account and the $1,000 deposit.
- [Employer Match Calculator](https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/employer-match): Calculate the impact of employer contributions under IRC §128.
- [Withdrawal Simulator](https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/withdrawal-simulator): Model post-18 withdrawal scenarios and tax implications.
- [Fund Expense Tracker](https://trumpaccounts.guide/calculators/fund-expense-tracker): Compare eligible S&P 500 and broad index fund expenses.

## Comparisons

- [Trump Account vs 529 Plan](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare/trump-account-vs-529): Education savings, tax treatment, and contribution limits compared.
- [Trump Account vs Roth IRA](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare/trump-account-vs-roth-ira): Earned income requirements, traditional vs Roth tax treatment.
- [Trump Account vs Custodial Account](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare/trump-account-vs-custodial-account): UTMA/UGMA, kiddie tax, and investment flexibility.
- [Trump Account vs Coverdell ESA](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare/trump-account-vs-coverdell): Income limits, age-30 deadline, and education savings.
- [Trump Account vs Baby Bonds](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare/trump-account-vs-baby-bonds): Universal vs income-targeted policy comparison.
- [All Comparisons](https://trumpaccounts.guide/compare): Side-by-side comparison hub.

## For Employers

- [Employer Contribution Guide](https://trumpaccounts.guide/for-employers): How to set up a Trump Account contribution program under IRC §128 — $2,500/year per employee, tax-free.

## FAQ Categories

- [Eligibility FAQs](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq/eligibility): Who qualifies, age cutoffs, citizenship requirements.
- [Tax FAQs](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq/taxes): Tax treatment, deductions, withdrawals after 18.
- [Money & Funding FAQs](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq/money-and-funding): Contribution limits, employer match, the $1,000 deposit.
- [Investment FAQs](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq/investments): Eligible funds, S&P 500 requirement, expense ratios.
- [Withdrawal FAQs](https://trumpaccounts.guide/faq/withdrawals-and-use): What happens at 18, early withdrawal rules, IRA conversion.

## Key Blog Articles

- [Trump Accounts for Newborns (2025-2028)](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/trump-accounts-for-newborns): $1,000 federal deposit for newborns, how to claim it, growth projections.
- [Trump Accounts Benefits: 7 Reasons to Open One](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/trump-accounts-benefits): Free deposit, no income limits, tax-deferred growth, employer matching, and more.
- [Who Qualifies for a Trump Account?](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/who-qualifies-for-trump-account): Eligibility requirements, no income limits, edge cases.
- [How Are Trump Account Gains Taxed?](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/gains-taxation-explained): Tax-deferred growth, ordinary income on withdrawal, Roth conversion strategy.
- [The Dell $6.25 Billion Pledge Explained](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/dell-pledge-explained): Dell and Trump Accounts — $250 per qualifying child.
- [Trump Account Contribution Limits (2026)](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/contribution-limits-explained): $5,000/year, employer match, inflation indexing.
- [Trump Accounts at Fidelity](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/trump-accounts-at-fidelity): FXAIX (0.015% ER), how to open, fees.
- [Trump Accounts at Schwab](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/trump-accounts-at-schwab): SWPPX (0.02% ER), physical branches, fees.
- [Trump Accounts at Robinhood](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog/trump-accounts-at-robinhood): Status, eligible ETFs, comparison with traditional brokerages.
- [All Blog Articles (60+)](https://trumpaccounts.guide/blog): Full article index.

## Key Facts (Source of Truth)

- Legal basis: IRC Section 530A, created by the One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), signed July 4, 2025
- IRS guidance: Notice 2025-68 (published December 3, 2025)
- Election form: IRS Form 4547 (Trump Account Election(s))
- Official portal: trumpaccounts.gov
- Pilot deposit: $1,000 one-time federal deposit for U.S. citizen children born Jan 1, 2025 - Dec 31, 2028
- Annual contribution limit: $5,000 (after-tax, indexed for inflation after 2027)
- Employer contribution: Up to $2,500/year per employee (tax-free under §128, counts toward $5,000 cap)
- Investment requirement: Must invest in mutual funds or ETFs tracking S&P 500 or broad U.S. equity index
- Growth phase: Birth through age 18 (no withdrawals except rollovers, excess contributions, or death)
- At age 18: Converts to a traditional IRA with standard IRA rules
- Eligibility: U.S. citizen, valid SSN, under 18 at end of election year. NO income restrictions
- Tax treatment: Earnings taxed as ordinary income on qualified withdrawals (traditional IRA treatment at 18)

## Sources

- [IRS Notice 2025-68 (PDF)](https://www.irs.gov/pub/irs-drop/n-25-68.pdf)
- [trumpaccounts.gov](https://trumpaccounts.gov)
- One Big Beautiful Bill Act (OBBBA), IRC Section 530A
